title: Web Performance Basics
description: Key concepts and practices to make websites feel fast and responsive.

content.text: Performance affects user experience, engagement, accessibility, and even search ranking. Fast sites feel trustworthy and pleasant to use.

items: HTML is parsed into the DOM.
CSS is parsed into the CSSOM.
DOM + CSSOM → Render tree → Layout → Paint.

content.text: Large blocking scripts or styles can delay this pipeline and slow down the first render.
defer waits for HTML parsing to finish before running. async runs as soon as the script is downloaded.
Layout thrashing happens when you repeatedly read and write layout properties in a tight loop.

items: Use browser DevTools performance and network panels.
Measure bundle size and load times.
Pay attention to initial load and interaction delay.
Test on slower devices or throttled networks.

content.text:
// Example: Cache-Control header
Cache-Control: max-age=31536000, immutable
Caching static assets reduces load times dramatically and improves perceived performance.

items: Optimise images first — they're usually the biggest files.
Use defer and async for scripts.
Use lazy loading for off-screen images.
Measure performance regularly, not just once.
